points: Took charge of a team of 4 developers taught them the overview of the web app's infrastructure in 4 days; explained to them how Django sends data from MongoDB to Angular for display and how to make APIs and services
Implemented, tested, and deployed a temporary data collection page within tight timeline constraints, had to learn the basics of Nginx and Docker in 2 days
Assisted with improving the project's foundational infrastrucsture and security, mainly with migrating over existing features
Consistently provided updates to managers and stakeholders, and always modified the website according to changes in their requirements
Adapted to heavier workloads and tighter deadlines within one day after remote work began
Wrote test cases and automation scripts in LeanFT C# on the 1st week of being onboarded to the mortgage/credit API project, reducing the runtime of tests (when done manually) by 70%
Fixed unfamiliar technical difficulties within one hour through analysis and troubleshooting, took the initiative of asking mentor for support if the issue was far beyond scope of knowledge
Collaborated with tech and cross-functional teams to gather requirements and determine tech stacks for developing the health startupâ€™s platform during 2 hour weekly meetings
Learned the basics of Django in 3 days with guidance from the CTO to start help building the backend infrastructure
Built a Python script which batch-books patients via SimplyBook API and extracts data for EMRs
